section.title: Configuration Files
section.para: Umit will always try to create a HOME/.umit configuration directory if it doesn't exists yet.
The steps bellow, describes how Umit is going to behave on every startup in order to load the configuration files:

procedure.title: Check if the location of the hardcoded paths does exist
If HOME/.umit does exist, than check the version of the files
If the version of the files is older than the current Umit version, update the config files
If HOME/.umit doesn't exist, tries to create one
If it is not possible to create the HOME/.umit, than Umit will use the factory-made files
